title: Warriors' Gate
dialogue_triumphs: We'll burn that bridge when we come to it.
You're a machine, aren't you? I usually get on so well with machines.
dialogue_disasters: The backblast backlash'll bounce back and destroy everything.
goofs: In episode two, a Gundan's axe falls onto the Doctor's back, without harm.
In episode three, a boom-mike pokes out from behind the MZ.
Adric takes K-9's ear, but when the dog arrives at the Doctor, it's got both.
When Packard swings K-9 overhead, its hollow interior is visible.
Lalla Ward has trouble pronouncing Romanadvoratrelundar.

locations.name: Zero coordinates
locations.description: A plain surface micro-universe at the boundary of E- and N-space
locations.origin: Created to serve as a defensive perimeter for the Tharil Empire

future_history: Humans use enslaved Tharils to navigate hyperspace, effectively travelling in time. The Tharil Empire used to exist in E-space, raiding N-space for human slaves, but the humans created the Gundans, who breached the Gate and destroyed the Empire.
additional_notes: A Tharil can walk the wind (possibly navigate the vortex) unharmed.
bottom_line: Praised for its direction, design, effects, music, and Romana's leaving scene. Notable elements include the coin, the gardens, and the banal villainy of the crew.
